mods.abstract: Diary written by Leroy Sullivan during his time in the Royal Canadian Air Force during World War II, beginning with a review of 1942 and flowing into a summary of the events of 1943. Diary entries are not dated, instead, the document read as an autobiography of Sullivan's life in late 1942 and 19423. Sullivan admits making a mistake in his choice to be stationed in England closer to the action rather than staying in Africa.

subject.topic: Great Britain. Royal Air Force. Squadron 56

subject.geographic: Royal Air Force Station, Martlesham Heath (Suffolk)

titleInfo.title: Leroy M. Sullivan diaries, 1941-1943
Leroy M. Sullivan diaries and correspondence
Special Collections
Leroy M. Sullivan World War II diaries and correspondence
